business.headline: Will AI change how you invest your money in stocks and mutual funds?The next market shift may not come from earnings or interest rates. It may come from AI. In this article, we explore how it could reshape your stock and mutual fund investments.

Air India fined Rs 1 crore for flying Airbus 8 times without airworthiness permitThe DGCA has imposed a fine of about Rs 1 crore on Air India for flying an Airbus aircraft eight times without a valid airworthiness permit. The aviation watchdog also said the lapse further eroded public trust in the airline.

Why personalised loans are becoming the go-to option in 2026The journey of hyper-personalisation in personal loans is going to get more exciting for customers with the increasing adoption of technology refining customer offerings, based on minute details of the customers.

RBI plans to update Kisan Credit Card rules : 5 key changes to trackThe Reserve Bank of India is preparing to overhaul the Kisan Credit Card scheme, and the proposed changes could reshape how farmers borrow and repay loans. With the new draft rules on the table, what exactly is set to change for farm credit?

Sensex crashes over 1,000 points: What's behind today's market bloodbath?The market opened on a weak note and remained under pressure throughout the session, with losses deepening in the second half. The decline appeared to be driven by profit booking at elevated levels and a cautious mood among investors amid global uncertainties.

Reliance wins US licence for Venezuelan oil as India wavers on Russia supplyReliance applied for the licence in early January as India looks to diversify its energy purchases. Direct purchase of Venezuelan oil will help Reliance replace Russian oil in a cost-effective way.

Cheque bounced? How one mistake can spiral into legal and financial troubleA bounced cheque may seem like a minor slip, but it can quickly trigger penalties, credit damage and even legal complications. What starts as a simple payment error can snowball into a serious financial setback. Are you aware of the risks?

8th Pay Commission: Government seeks public feedback; who can participateThe recommendations of the 8th Pay Commission are expected to influence future salary structures, allowances and pension benefits for central government staff.

Gold, silver prices rise slightly: Rise ahead or fall on the cards?After days of volatility, gold and silver have posted modest gains, catching the attention of investors. The small rise has reopened a familiar debate, i.e., are precious metals preparing for another climb, or is a fresh dip still possible?

RBI steps in to stop mis-selling by banks: Decoding what's good and what's not clearThe Reserve Bank of India has signalled its intent after years of rising mis-selling complaints. But will this draft protect ordinary customers before the next grievance is filed? In this article, we break down what changes, what remains unclear, and whether enforcement can finally make a difference.

65-10-10-15 rule: How a 4-asset 'boring thali' portfolio helps in uncertain marketsWhen markets feel uncertain and investors struggle to decide where to put their money, a simple multi-asset strategy is drawing attention. Instead of chasing trends, the 65-10-10-15 "boring thali" approach focusses on balance and steady investing.

Is it the end of the road for silver after a spectacular rally?After a stunning rally and an equally sharp fall, silver now sits at a crucial crossroads, leaving investors wondering whether this correction is nearing its end or still gathering momentum.

Sensex crashes over 1,000 points: Why is the stock market falling today?At 3:16 pm, the Sensex was down 1055.91 points to 82,619.01, while the Nifty stood at 25,481.35, lower by 325.85 points. The fall was led by heavy selling in IT stocks, but the triggers lie largely in global developments.

TCS, Infosys sink nearly 6%: 3 reasons why IT stocks are falling againShares of TCS and Infosys fell nearly 6% in early trade, dragging the Nifty IT index lower. The weakness was not driven by any one company-specific announcement. Instead, it reflects a mix of global triggers and rising uncertainty around how artificial intelligence will reshape the industry.

Sensex drops 700 points as AI panic hits IT stocks; Infosys, TCS drop 5%The Sensex fell over 700 points in early trade, while the Nifty slipped below the 25,600 mark. The decline was led by frontline technology majors such as Infosys and TCS, along with other large-cap IT names.

Retail inflation at 2.75% in January as India shifts to new CPI base year 2024The data, released by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation, reflects a major statistical overhaul aimed at making India's inflation measure more representative of current consumption patterns.

A 90-year-old man was sold a 100-year policy. Why blaming the bank is not enoughHandcrafted ByOur Editors A 90-year-old man was sold an insurance policy maturing in 2124. The case sounds bizarre. But instances of mis-selling like this are painfully common across the country. The bank resolved the matter after a viral social media post. The harder question is why blaming the bank alone is not enough.

Sensex sinks over 500 points, Nifty tumbles as AI panic sinks IT stocksThe benchmark BSE Sensex fell 559 points to close at 85,674.92, while the Nifty 50 slipped below the psychologically important 25,900 mark.

Aviation body writes to government as it bids to tighten cabin crew fatigue ruleThe Federation of Indian Airlines (FIA) has asked the government to dilute parts of the draft rules. The industry body represents IndiGo and Air India, and has raised concerns that the changes may create operational and cost pressures.

IT stocks crack under global AI pressure. Is this a buying chance?The Nifty IT index fell 4.67% by 12 PM, hitting a four-month low. The selloff wiped out nearly Rs 1.3 lakh crore in combined market value in a single session. The IT pack on the Sensex was also down nearly 5%.

entertainment.headline: Arbaz Patel removed from The 50 for slapping Prince Narula: Report Arbaz Patel has reportedly been ousted from The 50 following a physical confrontation with Prince Narula. The incident, linked to remarks about Nikki Tamboli, underscores the show's zero-tolerance policy on violence.

Nayanthara calls Vignesh her 'home in human form' on Valentine's Day, he responds Actor Nayanthara and filmmaker Vignesh Shivan marked Valentine's Day with deeply personal notes, but it was one line about "home in human form" that truly stood out.

Ranbir Kapoor confirms Love & War postponed; to release after Ramayana Actor Ranbir Kapoor went live on Instagram to announce key updates about his upcoming films. He confirmed Ramayana for Diwali release and shared timelines for Love & War and Brahmastra 2, exciting fans with future projects.

Dalip Tahil posts Valentine's Day apology for being love's 'most reliable enemy' Bollywood actor Dalip Tahil marked Valentine's Day with a dramatic apology to "love" itself , but why did the veteran actor call himself its greatest enemy?

Himanshi Khurana gets Rs 10 crore extortion threat from Lawrence Bishnoi aide Lawrence Bishnoi gang operative Harry Boxer has allegedly threatened actor Himanshi Khurana with an extortion demand of Rs 10 crore, triggering a police alert.

Happy kathal day to all: Irrfan Khan's wife Sutapa has heartfelt Valentine's post On Valentine's Day, Sutapa Sikdar remembered Irrfan Khan in her own unfiltered way, with green vegetables, red memories and a quiet rebellion against cliches.

Malavika Mohanan clears air on stunt double row around Prabhas' The Raja Saab Malavika Mohanan has explained her use of a stunt double in The Raja Saab following online discussion sparked by behind-the-scenes images. She shared her perspective and experience with action scenes, providing insight into standard safety practices on film sets.

Hollywood hearts: Stars on their kind of Valentine's Day Hollywood stars are sharing their heartfelt and personal plans for Valentine's Day. These unique celebrations highlight love in simple and meaningful ways, inspiring fans across the world.

Ghayal hoon isliye Ghatak hoon: See Sunny Deol's reaction on viral Dhurandhar line Sunny Deol reacts to the use of his film titles in the hit movie Dhurandhar and shares insights into his upcoming projects.

Main Hoon: Salman-Chitrangda trace love beyond duty in new Battle of Galwan song The newly released song Main Hoon from Battle of Galwan, featuring Salman Khan and Chitrangda Singh, captures the complex emotions experienced by soldiers and their families, blending scenes of togetherness with the reality of separation and duty.

Wuthering Heights, O Romeo, Culpa trilogy: Is yearning Gen Z's new love language? In a fast-moving world, romance is slowing down. Stories across films, series and books now lean into yearning, a shift that's resonating strongly with Millennials and Gen Z in India.

Dhanush in legal row over shelved film, faces Rs 20 crore claim: Report Legal disputes involving Dhanush and Ranveer Singh have emerged over unfinished film projects, with production houses seeking compensation for alleged delays and financial losses.

Jason Momoa says gentleman Shah Rukh Khan is a better performer than him Jason Momoa shared high praise for Shah Rukh Khan during a recent interview, highlighting their mutual respect and friendship after meeting at events in Saudi Arabia.

O' Romeo box office Day 1: Shahid Kapoor's best opening in recent years Directed by Vishal Bhardwaj, O' Romeo opened to a promising start at the Indian box office, drawing audience interest despite mixed reviews over its lengthy runtime.

At a crossroads: Telugu cinema must balance old-school magic with new-age demands Telugu cinema stands at the crossroads of tradition and change. Even as it reaches for pan-India scale, its heartbeat lies in the rituals and emotional bonds that have always connected it to its audience.

Tu Yaa Main box office Day 1: Shanaya-Adarsh's thriller has a muted opening Tu Yaa Main, a survival thriller featuring Shanaya Kapoor and Adarsh Gourav, made a cautious start at the Indian box office with an estimated Rs 55 lakh on its opening day. Despite mixed reviews and modest occupancy, the film's unique premise and stronger opening compared to the leads' previous films offer hope for better performance ahead.

Kohrra 2 finds its emotional core in Mona Singh Mona Singh delivers a restrained and powerful performance as Sub Inspector Dhanwant Kaur in Kohrra Season 2. Her portrayal highlights the silent grief and fierce dedication of a woman balancing personal loss with professional duty.

Police record Ranveer Singh, Rohit Shetty managers' statement, recreate crime scene Mumbai Police recorded statements from the managers of filmmaker Rohit Shetty and actor Ranveer Singh. The Crime Branch has also recreated the firing sequence at Shetty's residence by retracing the accused's scooter route from Pune to Mumbai.

Barun Sobti, Jaideep Ahlawat, Abhishek Banerjee in Kohrra creator's next: Report Actors Barun Sobti, Jaideep Ahlawat and Abhishek Banerjee will reportedly headline Sudip Sharma's upcoming Netflix series. Here's everything you need to know about the upcoming project.

general news.headline: Hopeful India will extradite Hasina, says BNP leader; sees no hurdle in tiesSenior BNP leader Mirza Fakhrul Islam Alamgir said the party is hopeful India will extradite former PM Sheikh Hasina if due legal process is followed.

In 1st remarks after election win, Tarique Rahman clears air on India tiesTarique Rahman, likely to be the next prime minister of Bangladesh, spoke on the future of India ties in his first address after steering the BNP to a landslide election win.

If Pakistan want Abhishek Sharma to play, he will play: Suryakumar YadavIND vs PAK, T20 World Cup: Suryakumar Yadav has hinted at young Abhishek Sharma's return to India's playing XI. Abhishek did not feature in India's last game, against Namibia, due to illness.

PM Modi makes historic touchdown on Assam's first emergency landing highwayPrime Minister Narendra Modi landed at the Northeast's first Emergency Landing Facility in Assam's Moran to inaugurate the strip and launch projects worth over Rs 5,500 crore.

Will street protests return to Bangladesh over Yunus's July Charter?BNP chief Tarique Rahman's electoral victory might have settled a battle. But the implementation of the Muhammad Yunus-driven July Charter, which secured a clear "Yes" in the referendum, could emerge as a challenge for Rahman. Bangladesh could see street protests and confrontational politics return.

India-Bangladesh ties require reset: Tarique Rahman's top aide after BNP's poll winWhile urging India to acknowledge the political change in Dhaka, BNP leader Humayun Kabir maintained that the new government would also adopt a "positive mindset" to bridge gaps and build constructive ties.

22-year-old Indian student from Karnataka missing in US, roommate seeks helpSaketh Sreenivasaiah, 22, from Karnataka is pursuing a master's in Chemical and Biomolecular Engineering at the University of California, Berkeley. His roommate posted on LinkedIn, asking for help to locate Sreenivasaiah.

1 killed, 3 injured after part of Mumbai Metro pillar collapses on moving autoPart of an under-construction metro pillar collapsed in Mumbai's Mulund, crushing an autorickshaw and part of a car, killing one and injuring three people.

India well-prepared for 'out of syllabus' Usman Tariq, says Suryakumar YadavIND vs PAK, T20 World Cup 2026: Suryakumar Yadav likened facing Pakistan's mystery spinner Usman Tariq to an 'out of syllabus exam question' but insists India will answer it.

India vs Pakistan in Colombo: Will spin flip the script in favour of underdogs?India vs Pakistan, T20 World Cup: It is going to be a battle of spinners at the R Premadasa Stadium on Sunday, February 15. For the first time ever, Pakistan's spin attack looks as potent as India's in any ICC tournament.

China's 'no thesis' PhDs target paper mills, plagiarism: Should India take note?China is testing a practical PhD model that allows select engineering scholars to graduate by building real-world products instead of writing traditional dissertations. The reform aims to curb paper mills and publish-or-perish culture. Could this model influence India's fight against it's own research misconduct problem?

Time, Tide & Tamil Part 24 | Anna Arch: Arrival of The Alliterative ArchitectConjeevaram Natarajan Annadurai – Anna to the masses – was born into a modest weaver family from the Sengunthar Mudaliar community, an environment where the rhythmic, hypnotic clatter of the handloom provided the background score to a life of early intellectual curiosity. The loom itself was a profound metaphor for his later life: Perfecting the art of weaving disparate, often contradictory threads of thought into a singular, durable fabric of social justice.

RIP European Super League: The end of football's most hated modern experimentReal Madrid's peace deal with UEFA has finally closed the book on the European Super League. What began as a breakaway power grab ends as a reminder that football's soul still belongs to its fans.

Hollywood hearts: Stars on their kind of Valentine's DayHollywood stars are sharing their heartfelt and personal plans for Valentine's Day. These unique celebrations highlight love in simple and meaningful ways, inspiring fans across the world.

The Biography of a Toilet Paper: How Pakistan became America's Disposable AllyFor seven decades, Pakistan has repeatedly offered itself as America's strategic pawn, only to be discarded when no longer useful. It is a pattern of servitude enabled through its own desperation and greed.

Russia killed opposition leader Alexei Navalny using frog toxin, UK and allies sayFive European nations have accused Russia of killing Alexei Navalny with the frog-derived toxin epibatidine, saying lab tests confirmed he was poisoned before his 2024 prison death.

At a crossroads: Telugu cinema must balance old-school magic with new-age demandsTelugu cinema stands at the crossroads of tradition and change. Even as it reaches for pan-India scale, its heartbeat lies in the rituals and emotional bonds that have always connected it to its audience.

Why a BJP win in Bangladesh is raising eyebrows across the borderThe BJP has won the Bhola-1 (Sadar) constituency in the Barisal division in Bangladesh. Since the headline has got you hooked to the story, read on to find out how.

Love, bullets on Valentine's Day: Couple found dead in car in NoidaThe bodies of Sumit and Rekha were found with gunshot wounds in a Tata Altroz near Noida Sector 39. Initial probe has suggested that Sumit first shot Rekha before turning the pistol on himself.

PM Modi may be invited to Tarique Rahman's swearing-in as Dhaka eyes resetBangladesh Nationalist Party is set to invite Prime Minister Narendra Modi to the swearing-in ceremony of Tarique Rahman after their election victory, signalling a boost in India-Bangladesh relations.

Ranbir Kapoor confirms Love & War postponed; to release after RamayanaActor Ranbir Kapoor went live on Instagram to announce key updates about his upcoming films. He confirmed Ramayana for Diwali release and shared timelines for Love & War and Brahmastra 2, exciting fans with future projects.

UP teen dies by suicide over breakup with girlfriend, family suspects murderThe victim, identified as Aman Giri, met his ex-girlfriend at a coaching centre, and the two had been in a relationship for eight months. However, the girl wanted to break up recently.

Passenger claims he was told to cooperate, adjust despite confirmed AC seats in trainAn Indian Railways passenger ranted about how he paid for confirmed 3rd AC seats but was asked to adjust by sharing seats during a train five-hour journey.

Why scientists are risking their lives for a solar eclipse in AntarcticaScientists at Antarctic stations are battling extreme cold to capture a rare solar eclipse. This high-stakes mission could reveal vital secrets about solar flares and space weather.

sports.headline: RIP European Super League: The end of football's most hated modern experiment Real Madrid's peace deal with UEFA has finally closed the book on the European Super League. What began as a breakaway power grab ends as a reminder that football's soul still belongs to its fans.

India well-prepared for 'out of syllabus' Usman Tariq, says Suryakumar Yadav IND vs PAK, T20 World Cup 2026: Suryakumar Yadav likened facing Pakistan's mystery spinner Usman Tariq to an 'out of syllabus exam question' but insists India will answer it.

England recover from West Indies loss, keep breathing after fighting past Scotland T20 World Cup, ENG vs SCO: England defeated Scotland by five wickets on Saturday, bouncing back from their earlier loss to the West Indies at the Wankhede. The Three Lions moved up to second place in the Group C table after chasing 153 in 18.2 overs.

NZ vs SA Live: Chapman, Mitchell steady Kiwis New Zealand (NZ) vs South Africa (SA) Live Score, T20 World Cup: New Zealand (90/4 in 9.4 overs). Mark Chapman and Daryl Mitchell have steadied the ship for the Kiwis as they have started to build a handy partnership.

If Pakistan want Abhishek Sharma to play, he will play: Suryakumar Yadav IND vs PAK, T20 World Cup: Suryakumar Yadav has hinted at young Abhishek Sharma's return to India's playing XI. Abhishek did not feature in India's last game, against Namibia, due to illness.

Wait for 24 hours: Suryakumar Yadav tight-lipped about Pakistan's handshake stance T20 World Cup: India captain Suryakumar Yadav remained coy on Saturday evening when asked whether his team would shake hands with Pakistan players in Sunday's Group A match at Colombo's R. Premadasa Stadium.

T20 World Cup, IND vs PAK: PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi to attend India clash T20 World Cup: Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) Chairman Mohsin Naqvi will attend Sunday's India vs Pakistan clash in Colombo. His visit is also expected to include talks with ICC officials following a brief boycott episode that had threatened the marquee fixture.

Afghanistan's Gurbaz earns Virat Kohli's respect, gifted bats after Ahmedabad show T20 World Cup: Virat Kohli gifted Rahmanullah Gurbaz two bats after his stunning T20 World Cup knock. The Afghan star called Kohli "not just a legend, but the inspiration for all generations" on Instagram.

T20 World Cup: Pakistan's Salman Agha wants Abhishek Sharma challenge in IND vs PAK Pakistan skipper Salman Ali Agha hopes the world No. 1 T20I batter, Abhishek Sharma, will play the high-voltage Group A clash of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026 between India and Pakistan. The arch-rivals will meet in match No. 27 on Sunday (February 15) at R. Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.

Australia vs India, Women's T20I series: Squads, all you need to know AUSW vs INDW: Harmanpreet Kaur's India and Sophie Molineux's Australia are all set to face off in a three-match T20I series, starting February 15 at the Sydney Cricket Ground. India started the tour with a five-wicket win over Governor General XI Women.

Pramod Bhagat bags record sixth BWF Para World Championships title India's Pramod Bhagat captured the men's SL3 gold medal with a commanding straight-game win over Indonesia's Muhammad Al Imran at the BWF Para World Championships on Saturday.

Harmanpreet Kaur calls for more Tests as India brace for tough Australia tourAUSW vs INDW: Harmanpreet Kaur said that India have enjoyed playing Test cricket and would want to play more in the future. Harmanpreet is set to lead India in the Australia tour, starting with the three-match T20I series.

India vs Pakistan: Weatherman Dahiya's Big Colombo forecast brings reliefIndia vs Pakistan is all set to steal the spotlight on Sunday, February 15, but the fans were left worried by the weather update, as Colombo is expected to have rain on the day of the game. However, weatherman Navdeep Dahiya has provided relief with his new update.

Usman Tariq's action cleared by ICC, stop the fuss: Pak captain Salman AghaT20 World Cup: Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha has urged everyone to stop questioning Usman Tariq's bowling action, saying the ICC has already cleared him twice. Tariq remains a key spin threat ahead of IND vs PAK in Colombo.

IRE vs OMA: Lorcan Tucker, Ireland blow mistake-ridden Oman out of T20 World CupT20 World Cup: Lorgan Tucker's 94 not out and a disciplined bowling effort saw Ireland crush Oman and knock them out of the T20 World Cup 2026 in Colombo on Saturday, February 14.

Cricket should be played with spirit: Pakistan captain open to handshakes with IndiaINS vs PAK T20 World Cup: Pakistan captain Salman Agha has said that his team is open to shaking hands with India. India refused to shake hands with Pakistan in the aftermath of the Pahalgam terror attack last year.

India vs Pakistan in Colombo: Will spin flip the script in favour of underdogs?India vs Pakistan, T20 World Cup: It is going to be a battle of spinners at the R Premadasa Stadium on Sunday, February 15. For the first time ever, Pakistan's spin attack looks as potent as India's in any ICC tournament.

After cheating admission, Norwegian biathlete Laegreid faces fresh Olympic stormFollowing his cheating admission, Sturla Holm Laegreid has got himself embroiled in a fresh controversy after winning a second individual bronze medal during the Winter Olympics 2026 on Friday, February 13.

Anil Kumble, Rahul Dravid thank Karnataka board for special Chinnaswamy honourFormer India duo Rahul Dravid and Anil Kumble expressed heartfelt gratitude to the Karnataka State Cricket Association after being honoured with stands named after them at the iconic M Chinnaswamy Stadium. The tribute marked a special moment for Bengaluru's cricketing legends.

Watch: Rahul Dravid emotional as The Wall gets a stand at Chinnaswamy StadiumRahul Dravid turned emotional as the KSCA named a Chinnaswamy Stadium stand after him in Bengaluru. The former India great called the venue his second home during a heartfelt thank-you speech.

Hardik's Valentine's Day gift to girlfriend Mahieka Sharma: A special tattooAhead of Valentine's Day, Hardik Pandya unveiled a new tattoo for his girlfriend, Mahieka Sharma. Hardik and Mahieka have been dating since 2025 and the Indian all-rounder got the tattoo as a symbol of their love.

Premier League: Frank sacked at Spurs as Carrick lifts United and chaos spreadsTottenham's decision to sack Thomas Frank has been linked to dressing-room unrest, with players reportedly frustrated by his constant praise of Arsenal. The Premier League week also saw Michael Carrick's United bounce back and injury woes deepen for Liverpool.

Babar Azam's formula to tackle India vs Pakistan pressure: Look straight aheadT20 World Cup: Babar Azam revealed his formula to tackle the pressure associated with an India vs Pakistan match ahead of their clash in the T20 World Cup on Sunday, February 15. Babar will be one of the key players for Pakistan during the clash.

Abhishek Sharma's parents reach Colombo while IND vs PAK availability still uncertainT20 World Cup: Abhishek Sharma's parents have arrived in Colombo as India await his fitness update ahead of the India vs Pakistan clash on February 15. The opener is recovering from a stomach infection, with his availability still uncertain.

Arshdeep Singh's Rahman Dakait moment before India vs Pakistan clash in ColomboArshdeep Singh channelled his inner Rahman Dakait as India received a special welcome in Colombo on Friday, Febraury 13 ahead of their clash against Pakistan in the T20 World Cup 2026. India will face Pakistan on Sunday.

U19 World Cup done, Vaibhav Sooryavanshi's next test is Class 10 board examsT20 World Cup: India's 14-year-old U19 World Cup hero Vaibhav Sooryavanshi is set to return to student life as he prepares for his Class 10 board exams. His school confirmed no special treatment despite his record-breaking final knock.

Dominating the Premadasa: India's T20I history in Colombo before India vs PakistanT20 World Cup, IND vs PAK: Suryakumar Yadav's India will aim to extend their impressive record at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo when they take on Salman Agha's Pakistan on Sunday in a crucial Group A clash.

India will win vs Pakistan, just play safe against Usman Tariq: Harbhajan SinghT20 World Cup: Harbhajan Singh has backed India to beat Pakistan in their February 15 T20 World Cup clash, but warned them to play mystery spinner Usman Tariq with caution. Tariq's rise has made him Pakistan's key threat.

Matchday Preview: South Africa, New Zealand look to strengthen Super 8 chancesDay 8 of the T20 World Cup features three high-stakes clashes, with Ireland vs Oman a virtual knockout, England seeking redemption against Scotland, and New Zealand meeting South Africa in a crucial battle for Super 8 qualification.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
